summary: Email chain regarding logistical issues with delivering a hard drive from the government to Ghislaine Maxwell while she is in custody at MDC. Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim presses for immediate delivery, while prison staff indicate her demands are inconsistent with typical mail handling for in-custody defendants.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is demanding immediate delivery of a government-provided hard drive to her client at MDC.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: In-custody defendant at MDC who is to receive a hard drive from the government; subject of the delivery logistics discussion.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, advocating for the immediate delivery of evidence (hard drive) to her client.

events.title: Hard Drive Delivery Request
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim sends an email demanding that a hard drive sent by the government to MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell be given to her immediately upon arrival.

events.title: Discussion on Delivery Logistics
events.description: Email exchange indicates defense counsel continues to press for special delivery requirements for Maxwell's mail, which prison staff view as inconsistent with typical treatment for in-custody defendants.

locations: MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, likely in New York)
New York, NY 10007 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 225 Broadway, Suite 715)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at MDC as of October 2021.
The government sent a hard drive to MDC for Maxwell via Federal Express.
Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim demanded the hard drive be given to Maxwell immediately upon arrival, citing 'time is of the essence.'
Prison staff indicated Maxwell's defense counsel was pressing for delivery requirements inconsistent with typical mail handling for in-custody defendants.
The email chain shows logistical friction between the defense and prison administration regarding evidence delivery.
